features: 4K Picture Perfection with 1 Billion+ Colors - More color than you can imagine. Over 1 billion colors enhanced with Quantum Color QLED. Contrast and brightness are optimized with VIZIO’s Dolby Vision HDR Bright Mode, HDR10+, Full Array LED Backlight and Active Pixel Tuning..Connectivity Technology : Bluetooth 5.2

America’s Smart TV - Instantly access millions of titles with America's Smart TV. Stream shows, movies, news, sports, music, and more on all your favorite apps, and enjoy over 250 free channels on WatchFree+.

Free TV Lives Here - Save on cable bills and stream for free with VIZIO WatchFree+. Built-in to every new VIZIO TV, WatchFree+ gives you 250+ live streaming channels and over 5,000 titles on demand. No subscriptions, logins, or fees.

Powerful Performance - The VIZIO M-Series Quantum has the horsepower for powerful 4K picture processing & ultra-fast download speeds utilizing VIZIO’s IQ Active Processor. Paired with built in Tri-band WiFi 6E, your VIZIO TV is the ultimate streaming machine.

The Future of Connectivity - Stream in the fast lane with WiFi 6E. Double the bandwidth of 5G, 6GHz acts as a superhighway, allowing you to stream more content without interrupting other connected devices in your Smart Home. That's ideal 4K streaming.
body.description: Welcome to the world of Color. Celebrate VIZIO’s 20th Anniversary with the NEW VIZIO M-Series Quantum Color Smart TV. Stream and game true-to-life details in 1 billion+ colors of picture perfection, all wrapped in VIZIO’s ThinFrame Design. America’s Smart TV gives you millions of movies, shows, sports, news, free channels, and more in seconds.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Ultra-low input lag and AMD FreeSync give you zero tearing and stutter-free gaming. Dolby Vision ensures you play as game developers intended.

America's Smart TV Stream it all. Access your favorite apps, cast from your phone, or watch hundreds of free channels. Free TV lives here. No fees, logins or subscriptions required. Hundreds of curated free channels and thousands of on demand titles. We work with everyone. Use Alexa, Google Home, and Apple Home for voice control and smart home integration. Stream from your device. Stream it all and more or mirror your screen for presentations and video chats directly on your VIZIO Smart TV.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Tons of value in this feature-packed TV
reviews.reviewText: I bought the 43-inch model for limited usage on days when it’s too sunny to use my projectors. I owned a 65-inch Vizio OLED model before switching to projectors. This TV doesn’t match the specs of this top-end OLED model, but its color output is pretty spectacular for a $300-on-sale set.Vizio includes lots of functionality with this model, as it works with Amazon, Apple and Google. I can’t recall seeing any TV or projector before offering this complete cross-platform functionality. You can use AirPlay and Chromecast as well as each companies’ digital assistants. I saw one comment saying AirPlay doesn’t work, but it fired right up for me on the first try.A key thing to look for with any TV or projector is color output. I researched this Dolby Vision-capable model on Rtings and saw it performed well, delivering a wide color gamut. This makes such a key difference when watching anything. I gave it the Moana test, and the ocean was a bright and inviting blue, and the land was a vibrant green. On the negative side, I think the picture isn’t the greatest for motion.Out of the box, the picture looked very good. I changed it to vivid and upped the color and tint to 60 each. I noticed some reds looked dark pink when the tint was at 50. Once at 60, things such as YouTube’s red play button looked spot-on.I think it’s cool that Vizio preloads apps, as this can save a lot of time during your setup, but one downside is that some apps folks might rely on such as TBS and TNT aren’t available. This might be because these companies don’t have the will or resources to develop and maintain apps for so many TV platforms, whose number is sizeable (Fire TV, Apple TV, Google and Android TV, Samsung’s Tizen, LG, etc.).One thing Vizio could improve is the use of higher-resolution app and video thumbnail images. If you’re close to the TV, you can see that they’re a bit grainy, but, from a few feet away, you can’t tell as well. This likely is a deliberate choice to help get the most legs out of the TV’s hardware. If so, it’s a smart choice. If you want razor-sharp images, hook up an Apple TV 4K, whose performance is exceptional and crushes even the NVIDIA Shield Pro.Enjoy! 📺

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I'm a Big Fan of VIZIO!!
reviews.reviewText: I have 7 VIZIO TVs in the house and rarely have an issue with them, the picture quality is great and I love the 4K with Dolby Atmos... It pairs up flawlessly with my VIZIO m51a Sound Bar... I can't say enough about how great the sound and picture is with this TV, I highly recommend this model, it's a good size for my bedroom.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Impressive Performance with a Few Packaging Quirks
reviews.reviewText: I recently purchased this product from Amazon, and overall, I am impressed with its performance. Let me share my experience and thoughts on this item:Starting with the positives, this product was remarkably easy to assemble and install. The setup process was straightforward, and I had it up and running in no time. The screen arrived well wrapped and protected, ensuring its safety during shipping.The stand of this TV is sturdy, providing reliable support and stability. This feature is particularly important for those who prefer to place their TV on a stand rather than mount it on the wall.One standout aspect is the Vizio software, which I found to be truly awesome. Compared to a Vizio TV I owned from 2015, this model surpasses it in terms of performance and features. The user interface is intuitive, responsive, and offers an enjoyable viewing experience.Furthermore, I appreciate the dynamic port labeling feature. It automatically relabels the HDMI ports based on the device connected, which makes switching inputs a breeze. For example, when turning on the Xbox, the TV automatically relabels the corresponding HDMI input as "Xbox," simplifying the user experience.However, there are a couple of negatives to note. Firstly, the TV is a bit heavy, requiring assistance from another person to move it properly. While this may not be a major concern during everyday use, it's worth considering if you plan on rearranging your setup frequently.Additionally, the original Vizio box that the TV arrived in had an unpleasant odor. Fortunately, this smell did not transfer to the TV itself. However, it was strong enough to warrant moving the box to the garage shortly after unboxing to prevent it from permeating the living room. Although the cause of the odor remains uncertain, it could be attributed to the ink used or the cardboard used in the packaging process.In summary, this product delivers impressive performance and offers a delightful viewing experience. The ease of assembly and installation, along with the sturdy stand, contribute to its overall appeal. The Vizio software surpasses previous models, and the dynamic port labeling adds convenience to switching inputs.However, it is important to note the weight of the TV, which may require assistance during movement. Additionally, the initial odor emanating from the original packaging box was unpleasant, although it did not affect the TV itself.Despite these minor drawbacks, I am satisfied with my purchase and believe this TV provides excellent value for the money. It's a worthwhile choice for those seeking a reliable and feature-rich television experience.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great price, great size
reviews.reviewText: Bought for my elderly neighbor to put on her bedroom dresser to replace a very old Vizio. She uses cable and doesn't care for streaming but it works very well. Paired her cable remote and it works great. Beautiful picture.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My wall was made for this television.
reviews.reviewText: Vizio really outdid themselves with this television. It’s incredibly clear and the visuals are amazing. The Vizio OS is so easy compared to the other cluster of mess out there. I’d honestly say it’s the best alternative if you don’t want the google tv OS or Web OS.It’s very sleek and has four inputs, it’s remote is simple but I like it.I don’t know all the technical mumbo jumbo so this review isn’t for that but I am pleased with my purchase. The tv works as intended. Works better than I expected actually. The free tv was a surprise for me, it showed images of it but I didn’t think it was actually giving me the option to watch free television. The Bluetooth headphone option is wonderful and any changes you need to made to the tv is done with a few clicks with the remote. None of the settings are buried deep and hidden.
